page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA
page.content: South Moor is an old mining village.To the South is the small community of Quaking Houses, named after an old Quaker meeting house.The majority of the housing was built prior to W.W.1 but many new Council houses have been added since.Community facilities are limited but there is a Sports Centre and modern shopping in nearby Stanley. Annfield Plain has the same mining traditions,but stands on the main Consett_Sunderland road and is therefore more accessible.Many new projects are in progress,including a new By_Pass,funded by the E.E.C.a large Medical Centre and an Old People's Living Complex. Whilst the area is run down industrially this has been no deterrent to the thriving community spirit.
